theme: The Church Militant: Tares Among the Wheat
introit: Worship Him, all you gods; Zion hears and is glad. The daughters of Judah rejoice because of Your judgments, O Lord. The Lord reigns, let the earth rejoice; Let the multitude of the isles be glad. Glory...
gradual:
The nations shall fear the Name of the Lord
And all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For the Lord shall build up Zion
He shall appear in His glory.
The Lord reigns, let the earth rejoice;
Let the multitude of the isles be glad.
Jesus Christ is the Light to lighten the Gentiles,
The Glory of Your people Israel.

introit: Make haste, O God, to deliver me! Make haste to help me, O Lord! Let them be ashamed and confounded who seek my life. Let them be turned back and confused who desire my hurt. Let them be turned back because of their shame. Glory...
gradual:
I will bless the Lord at all times;
His praise shall continually be in my mouth.
My soul shall make its boast in the Lord;
The humble shall hear of it and be glad.
Sing aloud to God our strength;
Make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

theme: Death and Burial:Young Man of Nain
introit: Be merciful to me, O Lord, For I cry to You all day long. For You Lord, are good, and ready to forgive. You are abundant in mercy to all those who call upon You. Bow down Your ear, O Lord, hear me; for I am poor and needy. Glory...
gradual:
The nations shall fear the Name of the Lord,
And all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For the Lord shall build up Zion;
He shall appear in His glory.
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;
He is their Help and their Shield.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: A great multitude which no one could number stood before the throne and before the Lamb. Clothed with white robes, with palm branches in their hands. Crying out in a loud voice, saying: "Salvation belongs to our God who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb!" Glory...
gradual:
There is no want to those who fear Him.
Those who seek the Lord
Shall not lack any good thing.
Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden,
And I will give you rest.
Magnify the Lord with me,
Let us exalt His Name together.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

Behold, God is my helper; the Lord is with those who uphold my soul. He will repay my enemies for their evil. Cut them off in Your truth. Save me, O God, by Your Name, And vindicate me by Your strength. Glory...
gradual:
O Lord, our Lord, how excellent is Your Name in all the earth,
You who set Your Glory above the heavens.
The heart of the righteous is steadfast;
Surely he will never be shaken.
Blessed is the man who fears the Lord,
Who delights greatly in His commands.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: When I awake, I am still with You. Alleluia! You have laid Your hand upon Me. Alleluia! Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, it is high, I cannot attain it. Alleluia! O Lord, You have searched me and known me, You have known my sitting down and my rising up. Glory...
gradual:
This is the day which the Lord has made,
We will rejoice and be glad in it.
Oh, give thanks to the Lord, for He is good!
Because His mercy endures forever.
I shall not die, but live
And declare the works of the Lord.
Hallelujah! Christ, our Passover is sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast. Hallelujah!

introit: Rain down, you heavens from above, and let the skies pour down righteousness. Let the earth open, and bring forth salvation. The heavens declare the Glory of God, And the firmament shows His handiwork. Glory...
gradual:
The Lord is near to all who call upon Him,
To all that call upon Him in truth.
My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord,
And all flesh shall bless His holy Name.
You are my Help and my Deliverer;
Do not delay, O my God.
Let the heavens rejoice and let the earth be glad before the Lord,
For He has made known His Salvation.

introit: O Lord, King Almighty, Your power is over all things; there is no one who is able to resist Your will. You have made heaven and earth and all things enclosed by the heavens. Blessed are the undefiled in the way, Who walk in the law of the Lord. Glory...
gradual:
In all generations.
Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever You had formed the earth and the world,
From everlasting to everlasting, You are God.
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion,
Which cannot be moved, but abides forever.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: When Israel was a child, I loved him, and out of Egypt I called My Son. Why do the nations rage, and the people plot a vain thing? The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, Against the Lord and against His Anointed. Glory...
gradual:
Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the Gentiles
To give thanks to Your holy Name, to triumph in Your praise.
You, O Lord, are our Father;
Our Redeemer from Everlasting is Your name.
My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord;
And all flesh shall bless His holy Name forever and ever.
Let the heavens rejoice and let the earth be glad before the Lord,
For He has made known His Salvation.

introit: The Lord of Hosts is with us, the God of Jacob is our Refuge. Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be removed and the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea. God is our Refuge and Strength, A very present Help in trouble. Glory...
gradual:
In the city of our God, in His holy mountain.
Walk about Zion, and go all around her. Count her towers, mark well her bulwarks.
That you may tell it to the generation following.
For this is our God, our God forever and ever;
He will be our Guide, even to death.
I will speak Your testimonies also before kings,
And will not be put to shame.

introit: Bless the Lord, you His angels, who excel in strength and do His word. Bless the Lord, all you His hosts, who heed the voice of His Word. Bless the Lord, O my soul; And all that is within me, bless His holy Name! Glory...
gradual:
To keep you in all your ways.
Bless the Lord, O my soul;
And all that is within me, bless His holy Name!
And one cried to another and said:
“Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts; the whole earth is full of His glory!”
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

Say to my soul, "I am your Salvation." The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears. He delivers them out of their troubles. Give ear, O My people, to My law; Incline your ears to the words of My mouth. Glory...
gradual:
Let my prayer be set before You as incense,
The lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
Attend to my cry, O Lord,
For I am brought very low.
O, sing to the Lord a new song!
For He has done marvelous things.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: Say to my soul, "I am your Salvation." The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears. He delivers them out of their troubles. Give ear, O My people, to My law; Incline your ears to the words of My mouth. Glory...
gradual:
The lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
Attend to my cry, O Lord,
For I am brought very low.
O, sing to the Lord a new song!
For He has done marvelous things.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: Oh come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the Lord our Maker. For He is our God, and we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand. Oh come, let us sing to the Lord; Let us shout joyfully to the Rock of our salvation. Glory...
gradual:
My eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
I love the Lord,
Because He has heard my voice and my supplications.
With You is the fountain of life;
In Your light we see light.
Behold, I am coming quickly.
Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus!

theme: Triumph over Satan: Jesus Casts Out A Demon
introit: My eyes are ever toward the Lord, for He shall pluck my feet out of the net. To You, O Lord, I lift up my soul, O my God, I trust in You. Turn Yourself to me and have mercy on me, For I am desolate and afflicted. Glory...
gradual:
Arise, O Lord, do not let man prevail,
Let the nations be judged in Your sight.
When my enemies fall back
They shall perish at Your presence.
Unto You I lift up my eyes, You who dwell in the heavens.
Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us!
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: The rich among the people will seek your favor.  She shall be brought to the King in robes of many colors; The virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to You.  With gladness and rejoicing they shall be brought.  My heart is overflowing with a good theme; I recite my composition concerning the King.  Glory...

theme: Forgive as Forgiven: The Unmerciful Servant
introit: If You, O Lord, should mark iniquities, O Lord, who could stand? But there is forgiveness with You, that You may be feared. Out of the depths I have cried to You, O Lord; Lord, hear my voice. Glory...
gradual:
Behold, how good and pleasant it is
For brethren to dwell together in unity!
The Lord commanded the blessing:
Life forevermore.
The Lord heals the brokenhearted
And binds up their wounds.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: To You, O Lord, I lift up my soul; O my God, I trust in You. Let me not be ashamed; let not my enemies triumph over me. Indeed, let no one who waits on You be ashamed. Show me Your ways, O Lord; teach me Your paths. Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Ghost; as it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, forevermore. Amen.
gradual:
Show me Your ways, O Lord; teach me Your paths.
Lift up Your heads, O you gates! Lift up, you everlasting doors!
And the King of Glory shall come in.
Who is this King of Glory?
The Lord of Hosts, He is the King of Glory!
Remember, O Lord, Your tender mercies and lovingkindness,
For they are from of old.

introit: Oh come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the Lord our Maker. For He is our God, and we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand. Oh come, let us sing to the Lord; Let us shout joyfully to the Rock of our salvation. Glory...
gradual:
You have delivered my soul from death,
My eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
I love the Lord,
Because He has heard my voice and my supplications.
With You is the fountain of life;
In Your light we see light.
Behold, I am coming quickly.
Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus!

theme: Forgive as Forgiven: The Unmerciful Servant
introit: If You, O Lord, should mark iniquities, O Lord, who could stand? But there is forgiveness with You, that You may be feared. Out of the depths I have cried to You, O Lord; Lord, hear my voice. Glory...
gradual:
For brethren to dwell together in unity!
The Lord commanded the blessing:
Life forevermore.
The Lord heals the brokenhearted
And binds up their wounds.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: The Lord was my Support. He brought me out into a broad place. He delivered me because He delighted in me. I will love You, O Lord, my Strength; The Lord is my Rock and my Fortress. Glory...
gradual:
In my distress I called to the Lord,
And He heard me.
Deliver my soul, O Lord,
From lying lips and from a deceitful tongue.
God is a just judge,
And God is angry with the wicked every day.
Blessed be the Lord God of our fathers,
Praise Him and highly exalt Him forever.

theme: Jesus, Son of Abraham: Our High Priest
introit: Vindicate me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation. Deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man. Send out Your light and Your truth; Let them lead me, let them bring me to Your holy hill. Glory...
gradual:
Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies,
Teach me to do Your will.
He delivers me from my enemies, You lift me up above those who rise against me.
You have delivered me from the violent man.
Many a time they have afflicted me from my youth,
Yet they have not prevailed against me.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: The Lord is the Strength of His people, He is the saving Strength of His Anointed. Save Your people and bless Your inheritance, shepherd them and bear them up forever. To You I will cry, O Lord, my Rock; do not be silent to me, Lest, if You are silent to me, I become like those who go down to the pit. Glory...
gradual:
Return, O Lord! How long?
Have compassion on Your servants.
Lord, You have been our dwelling place
In all generations.
In You, O Lord, I put my trust; let me never be ashamed, deliver me in Your righteousness.
Bow down Your ear to me, deliver me speedily.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: The Lord is my Light and my Salvation; Whom shall I fear? The Lord is the Strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid? When the wicked came up against me, my enemies and my foes, They stumbled and fell. Though an army should encamp against me, My heart shall not fear. Glory...
gradual:
O Lord, provide atonement for our sins.
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”
Help us, O God of our salvation,
For the glory of Your Name deliver us.
You sat on the throne judging in righteousness;
Be a Refuge for the oppressed in times of trouble.
Blessed be the Lord God of our fathers,
Praise Him and highly exalt Him forever.

dayname: St. Philip and St. James, Apostles
introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

God forbid that I should glory Except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ. In Him is salvation, life, and resurrection from the dead: by Him we are redeemed and set at liberty. God be merciful to us and bless us: and cause His face to shine on us. Glory...
Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice; You have been my Help. Do not leave me or forsake me, O God of my salvation. The Lord is my Light and my Salvation; Whom shall I fear? Glory...
gradual:
O God, behold our Shield,
And look upon the face of Your Anointed.
O Lord God of hosts,
Hear our prayer.
The king shall have joy in Your strength,
And in Your salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
Blessed be the Lord God of our fathers,
Praise Him and highly exalt Him forever.

introit: Worship Him, all you gods; Zion hears and is glad. The daughters of Judah rejoice because of Your judgments, O Lord. The Lord reigns, let the earth rejoice; Let the multitude of the isles be glad. Glory...
gradual:
The nations shall fear the Name of the Lord
And all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For the Lord shall build up Zion
He shall appear in His glory.
The Lord reigns, let the earth rejoice;
Let the multitude of the isles be glad.
Jesus Christ is the Light to lighten the Gentiles,
The Glory of Your people Israel.

theme: Bread of Life: Jesus Feeds Five Thousand
introit: Rejoice with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all you who love her. Rejoice with her, all you who mourn for her. I was glad when they said to me, "Let us go into the house of the Lord." Glory...
gradual:
I was glad when they said to me,
“Let us go into the house of the Lord.”
Peace be within your walls,
Prosperity within your palaces.
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion
Which cannot be removed, but abides forever.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: Bow down Your ear, O Lord, hear me. You are my God, save Your servant who trusts in You! Be merciful to me, O Lord, for I cry to You all day long. Rejoice the soul of Your servant, For to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul. Glory...
gradual:
It is better to trust in the Lord
Than to put confidence in man.
It is better to trust in the Lord
Than to put confidence in princes.
O God, my heart is steadfast;
I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: Oh, clap your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with the voice of triumph. For the Lord Most High is awesome. He will subdue the peoples under us, And the nations under our feet. Glory...
gradual:
Come, you children, listen to me;
I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
They looked to Him and were radiant,
And their faces were not ashamed.
O, clap your hands, all you peoples!
Shout to God with the voice of triumph.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: O God, behold our Shield, and look upon the face of Your Anointed. A day in Your courts is better than a thousand. How lovely is Your tabernacle, O Lord of Hosts! My soul longs, yes, even faints, for the courts of the Lord. Glory...
gradual:
It is a good thing to give thanks to the Lord,
And to sing praises to Your Name, O Most High.
To declare Your lovingkindness in the morning
And Your faithfulness every night.
Praise is awaiting You, O God, in Zion;
And to You the vow shall be performed.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

dayname: St. Simon and St. Jude, Apostles
introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

The Spirit of the Lord fills the whole world. Alleluia! Let the righteous be glad, let them rejoice before God. Let God arise, let His enemies be scattered; Let those also who hate Him flee before Him. Glory...
gradual:
You hide Your face, they are troubled;
You take away their breath, they die.
You send forth Your Spirit, they are created;
And You renew the face of the earth.
May the glory of the Lord endure forever;
May the Lord rejoice in His works.
Come, Holy Spirit, and fill the hearts of Your faithful people,
And kindle in them the fire of Your love.

introit: Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from those who persecute me. Do not let me be ashamed, O LORD, for I have called upon You; In You, O LORD, I put my trust; Let me never be ashamed. Glory...
gradual:
They set up their banners for signs.
Remember Your congregation, which You purchased of old,
The tribe of Your inheritance, which You have redeemed.
There is a river whose streams shall make glad the city of God,
God is in the midst of her, she shall not be moved.
Behold, I am coming quickly.
Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus!

introit: With a voice of singing, declare, proclaim this utter it even to the ends of the earth: say, "The Lord has redeemed His servant Jacob." Alleluia! O You who hear prayer, to You all flesh will come. Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth! Sing out the honor of His name, make His praise glorious. Glory...
gradual:
Christ, who has redeemed us with His blood
Has risen and appeared to us.
If I am lifted up from the earth
I will draw all peoples to Myself.
I came forth from the Father and have come into the world.
Again, I leave the world and go to the Father.
Hallelujah! Christ, our Passover is sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast. Hallelujah!

introit: Save me, O God, by Your name, and vindicate me by Your strength.  Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.  He will repay my enemies for their evil.  Cut them off in Your truth. Glory...
gradual:
And to the earth, that He may judge His people.
Let the heavens declare His righteousness,
For God Himself is Judge.
The ransomed of the Lord shall return, and come to Zion with singing, with everlasting joy on their heads.
They shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
Behold, I am coming quickly.
Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus!

introit: Rain down, you heavens from above, and let the skies pour down righteousness.  Let the earth open, and bring forth salvation.  My heart is overflowing with a good theme; I recite my composition concerning the King.  Glory...
gradual:
And a Branch shall grow out of his roots.
Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a Son,
And shall call His name Immanuel.
The angel came in and said to her, “Greetings, you who
are highly favored!
“The Lord is with you.”
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: All the earth shall worship You and sing praises to You. They shall sing praises to Your Name. Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth! Sing out the honor of His Name, make His praise glorious. Glory...
gradual:
The Lord sent His Word and healed them
And delivered them from their destructions.
Oh, that men would give thanks to the Lord for His goodness,
And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
Praise Him, all His angels!
Praise Him, all His hosts!
Jesus Christ is the Light to lighten the Gentiles,
The Glory of Your people Israel.

theme: The New Creation: A Little While
introit: Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth! Sing out the honor of His name, make His praise glorious. Alleluia! Say to God, "How awesome are Your works! Through the greatness of Your power Your enemies shall submit themselves to You." All the earth shall worship You and sing praises to You. Glory...
gradual:
I will praise the Lord with my whole heart
In the assembly of the upright and in the congregation.
The Lord has sent redemption to His people.
He has commanded His covenant forever.
Thus it is written and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer
And to rise from the dead the third day.
Hallelujah! Christ, our Passover is sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast. Hallelujah!

theme: Missions: Jesus Heals a Leper and a Servant
introit: Worship Him, all you gods; Zion hears and is glad. The daughters of Judah rejoice because of Your judgments, O Lord. The Lord reigns, let the earth rejoice; Let the multitude of the isles be glad. Glory...
gradual:
The nations shall fear the Name of the Lord
And all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For the Lord shall build up Zion
He shall appear in His glory.
The Lord reigns, let the earth rejoice;
Let the multitude of the isles be glad.
Jesus Christ is the Light to lighten the Gentiles,
The Glory of Your people Israel.

introit: Turn Yourself to me and have mercy on me, for I am desolate and afflicted. Look on my affliction and my pain, and forgive all my sins. To You, O Lord, I lift up my soul. O my God, I trust in You, let me not be ashamed. Glory...
gradual:
Cast your burden on the Lord,
And He shall sustain you.
I will call upon God, and the Lord shall save me.
He has redeemed my soul in peace.
I will love You, O Lord, my Strength;
The Lord is my Rock and my Fortress and my Deliverer.
Blessed be the Lord God of our fathers,
Praise Him and highly exalt Him forever.

theme: The Singing Church: The Spirit of Truth
introit: Oh, sing to the Lord a new song! For He has done marvelous things. Alleluia! The Lord has made known His Salvation; His Righteousness He has openly shown in the sight of the nations. His Right Hand and His holy arm have gained Him the victory. Glory...
gradual:
The Lord is my strength and my song
And He has become my Salvation.
The Right Hand of the Lord is exalted;
The Right Hand of the Lord does valiantly.
Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more.
Death no longer has dominion over Him.
Hallelujah! Christ, our Passover is sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast. Hallelujah!

theme: Jesus, Savior of Gentiles: The Wise Men
introit: Behold, the Lord, the Ruler, has come, and the kingdom and the power and the glory are in His hand. All kings shall fall down before Him, all nations shall serve Him. Give the King Your judgments, O God, And Your righteousness to the King''s Son. Glory...
gradual:
All those from Sheba will come, they shall bring gold and incense
And they shall proclaim the praises of the Lord.
Arise, shine, for your Light is come
And the Glory of the Lord is risen upon you.
We have seen His star in the east
And have come with gifts to worship the Lord.
Jesus Christ is the Light to lighten the Gentiles,
The Glory of Your people Israel.

theme: The Fulfillment of All That Was Spoken

introit: Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from those who persecute me. Do not let me be ashamed, O LORD, for I have called upon You; In You, O LORD, I put my trust; Let me never be ashamed. Glory...
gradual:
They set up their banners for signs.
Remember Your congregation, which You purchased of old,
The tribe of Your inheritance, which You have redeemed.
There is a river whose streams shall make glad the city of God,
God is in the midst of her, she shall not be moved.
Behold, I am coming quickly.
Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus!

introit: You are fairer than the sons of men, grace is poured upon Your lips.  Therefore God has blessed You forever.  Gird Your sword upon Your thigh, O Mighty One, With Your glory and Your majesty.  Glory...
gradual:
You have declared Your strength among the peoples.
You have with Your arm redeemed Your people,
The sons of Jacob and Joseph.
Make a joyful shout to the Lord, all You lands!
Serve the Lord with gladness, come before His presence with thanksgiving.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

theme: Heaven's Eternal Joy: The Bride of Christ
introit: I know the thoughts I think toward you, says the Lord, thoughts of peace and not of evil.  Then you will call upon Me and go and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.  Lord, You have been favorable to Your land; You have brought back the captivity of Jacob.  Glory...
gradual:
The King’s daughter shall be brought to the King;
The virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to You.
With gladness and rejoicing they shall be brought;
They shall enter the king’s palace.
Then I saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,
Prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
Behold, I am coming quickly.
Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus!

theme: The Birthday of the Lutheran Church
introit: I will speak of Your testimonies also before kings, And will not be ashamed. God is our refuge and strength, A very present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear, Even though the earth be removed, And though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea; I will speak of Your testimonies also before kings, And will not be ashamed. Glory...

Vindicate me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation. Deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man. Send out Your light and Your truth; Let them lead me, let them bring me to Your holy hill.
gradual:
You hold me by my right hand
You will guide me with Your counsel and afterward receive me to glory
Truly God is good to Israel,
To such as are pure in heart.
But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled;
My steps had nearly slipped when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: O Lord, our Lord, how excellent is Your Name in all the earth, You who set Your Glory above the heavens! What is man that You are mindful of him, the Son of Man that You visit Him? You, O Lord, are our Father; Our Redeemer from Everlasting is Your name. Glory...

As newborn babes, desire the pure milk of the Word. Alleluia! Hear, O My people, and I will admonish you, O Israel, if you would listen to Me! Sing aloud to God our strength, make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob. Glory...
gradual:
Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more.
Death no longer has dominion over Him.
An angel of the Lord descended from heaven.
He rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it.
Blessed are those who have not seen
And yet have believed.
Hallelujah! Christ, our Passover is sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast. Hallelujah!

introit: The earth is full of the goodness of the Lord. Alleluia! By the Word of the Lord the heavens were made. Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous! For praise from the upright is beautiful. Glory...
gradual:
Then was the Lord Jesus known to them
In the breaking of bread.
I am the Good Shepherd,
I know My sheep and am known by My own.
My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life
That I may take it up again.
Hallelujah! Christ, our Passover is sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast. Hallelujah!

introit: The Lord our God is righteous in all the works which He does, though we have not obeyed His voice. Give glory to Your Name, O Lord, and deal with Your servant according to Your mercy. Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised In the city of our God, in His holy mountain. Glory...
gradual:
The eyes of all look expectantly to You
And You give them their food in due season.
You open Your hand
And satisfy the desire of every living thing.
Out of the depths I have cried to You, O Lord;
Lord, hear my voice!
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

dayname: Nativity of St. John the Baptist
theme: The Nativity of John the Baptist
introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

Be my Rock of refuge, a Fortress of defense to save me. For You are my Rock and my Fortress, therefore for Your Name''s sake lead me and guide me. In You, O Lord, I put my trust, Let me never be ashamed. Glory...
gradual:
You are the God who does wonders,
You have declared Your strength among the peoples.
You have with Your arm redeemed Your people,
The sons of Jacob and Joseph.
Make a joyful shout to the Lord, all You lands!
Serve the Lord with gladness, come before His presence with thanksgiving.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

Your testimonies are very sure, holiness adorns Your house O Lord, forever. Your throne is established from of old, You are everlasting. The Lord reigns, He is clothed with majesty; The Lord is clothed, He has girded Himself with strength. Glory...
gradual:
You are fairer than the sons of men;
Grace is poured out on Your lips.
My heart is overflowing with a good theme; I recite my composition concerning the King.
My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
God, Your God, has anointed You with the oil of gladness.
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever.
Let the heavens rejoice and let the earth be glad before the Lord,
For He has made known His Salvation.

introit: O Lord, King Almighty, Your power is over all things; there is no one who is able to resist Your will. You have made heaven and earth and all things enclosed by the heavens. Blessed are the undefiled in the way, Who walk in the law of the Lord. Glory...
gradual:
Lord, You have been our Dwelling Place
In all generations.
Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever You had formed the earth and the world,
From everlasting to everlasting, You are God.
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion,
Which cannot be moved, but abides forever.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

The Lord our God is righteous in all the works which He does, though we have not obeyed His voice. Give glory to Your Name, O Lord, and deal with Your servant according to Your mercy. Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised In the city of our God, in His holy mountain. Glory...
gradual:
And You give them their food in due season.
You open Your hand
And satisfy the desire of every living thing.
Out of the depths I have cried to You, O Lord;
Lord, hear my voice!
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

theme: Word of God: Sower and the Seed
introit: Awake! Why do You sleep, O Lord? Arise! Do not cast us off forever. Why do You hide Your face and forget our affliction and our oppression? We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us What deeds You did in their days. Glory...
gradual:
Let the people know that Your Name is the Lord
You alone are the Most High over all the earth.
O my God, make them like the whirling dust,
Like chaff before the wind!
O God, You have shown Your people hard things
That Your beloved may be delivered, save with Your Right Hand.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

theme: Citizenship: Render to Caesar and to God
introit: I know the thoughts I think toward you, says the Lord, thoughts of peace and not of evil. Then you will call upon Me and pray to Me, and I will listen to you. Lord, You have been favorable to Your land; You have brought back the captivity of Jacob. Glory...
gradual:
You have saved us from our enemies,
And have put to shame those who hated us.
In God we boast all day long,
And praise Your Name forever.
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;
He is their Help and their Shield.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

introit: Daughter of Zion, surely your Salvation is coming. The Lord will cause His glorious voice to be heard, and you shall have gladness of heart. Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, You who lead Joseph like a flock; Stir up Your strength, and come and save us! Glory.. .
gradual:
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shines forth;
Our God shall come, and shall not keep silent
Gather My saints together to Me,
Those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.
The powers of the heavens will be shaken, then they shall see
the Son of Man
Coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
Remember, O Lord, Your tender mercies and lovingkindness,
For they are from of old.

dayname: St. Peter and St. Paul, Apostles
introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

When all was still and it was midnight, Your almighty Word, O Lord, descended from the royal throne.  The Lord reigns, He is clothed with majesty.  The Lord said to Me, "You are My Son, today I have begotten You."  Glory...

theme: By Grace Alone: Laborers in the Vineyard
introit: The pangs of death encompassed me, the sorrows of hell surrounded me. The floods of ungodliness made me afraid. In my distress I called upon the Lord, And He heard my voice from His temple. Glory...
gradual:
The Lord will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
And those who know Your Name will put their trust in You, for You, Lord, have not forsaken those who seek You.
For the needy shall not always be forgotten, the expectation of the poor shall not perish forever.
Arise, O Lord, do not let man prevail.
If You, Lord should mark iniquities, O Lord, who could stand?
But there is forgiveness with You, that You may be feared.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: Unto Us a Child is born, unto us a Son is given, and government will be upon His shoulder.  His name shall be called Worderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.  Oh, sing to the Lord a new song, For He has done marvelous things.  Glory...
gradual:
All the ends of the earth have seen the Salvation of our God;
Shout joyfully to the Lord, all the earth.
The Lord has made known His Salvation;
His Righteousness He has revealed in the sight of the nations.
The Lord said to Me, “You are My Son, today I have begotten You.”
Oh, come let us sing to the Lord, let us worship and bow down.
Let the heavens rejoice and let the earth be glad before the Lord,
For He has made known His Salvation.

theme: Youth: The Boy Jesus in the Temple
introit: I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up. I heard the voice of a great multitude saying, "Alleluia! For the Lord God Omnipotent reigns!" Make a joyful shout to the Lord, all you lands. Serve the Lord with gladness. Glory...
gradual:
Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel, who only does
wondrous things.
Blessed be His glorious Name forever!
The mountains will bring peace to Your people
And the little hills righteousness.
Make a joyful shout to the Lord, all you lands.
Serve the Lord with gladness.
Jesus Christ is the Light to lighten the Gentiles,
The Glory of Your people Israel.

introit: Rejoice in the Lord always. Again I will say, rejoice! Let your gentleness be known to all men. The Lord is at hand. Be anxious for nothing, but in everything by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, let your requests be known to God. Lord, You have been favorable to Your land; You have brought back the captivity of Jacob. Glory...
gradual:
Show us Your mercy, Lord,
And grant us Your Salvation.
I will hear what God the Lord will speak, for He will speak peace to His people and to His saints.
Surely His Salvation is near to those who fear Him.
Behold, I send My messenger,
And he will prepare the way before Me.
Remember, O Lord, Your tender mercies and lovingkindness,
For they are from of old.

theme: Persistent Faith: The Woman of Canaan
introit: Remember, O Lord, Your tender mercies and lovingkindnesses, for they have been from of old. Let not my enemies triumph over me. Redeem Israel, O God, Out of all their troubles! To You, O LORD, I lift up my soul. O my God, I trust in You; Let me not be ashamed Glory...
gradual:
The troubles of my heart have enlarged;
Oh, bring me out of my distresses!
Look on my affliction and pain
And forgive me all my sins.
O give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good!
For His mercy endures forever!
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.

introit: Men of Galilee, why do you stand gazing up into heaven? Alleluia! This same Jesus, who was taken up from you into heaven, will so come in like manner as you saw Him go into heaven. Alleluia! Alleluia! Oh, clap your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with the voice of triumph! Glory...
gradual:
The Lord with the sound of a trumpet.
Oh, clap your hands, all you peoples!
Shout to God with the voice of triumph!
God reigns over the nations;
God sits on His holy throne.
You have ascended on high,
You have led captivity captive.

theme: Humility: The Pharisee and the Tax-Collector
introit: God is in His holy habitation; He sets the solitary in families. The God of Israel gives strength and power to His people. Let God arise, let His enemies be scattered; Let those also who hate Him flee before Him. Glory...
gradual:
My heart trusted in God, and I am helped,
My heart greatly rejoices and with my song I will praise Him.
To You, I will cry, O Lord my Rock,
Do not be silent to me; hear the voice of my supplications.
Lord, You have been our dwelling place
In all generations.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

theme: Apostles and Prophets: Rich Man and Lazarus
introit: I have trusted in Your mercy, my heart shall rejoice in Your salvation. I will sing to the Lord, because He has dealt bountifully with me. How long, O Lord? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me? Glory...
gradual:
I said, “Lord, be merciful to me;
Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
Blessed is he who considers the poor;
The Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.
Give ear to my words, O Lord,
Consider my meditation.
Blessed be the Lord God of our fathers,
Praise Him and highly exalt Him forever.

introit: We have thought, O God, on Your lovingkindness, in the midst of Your temple. According to Your Name, O God, so is Your praise to the end of the earth. Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised, In the city of our God, in the mountain of His holiness. Glory...
gradual:
Be my rock of refuge,
A fortress of defense to save me.
In You, O Lord, I put my trust,
Let me not be ashamed.
Give ear, O my people, to my law;
Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: Hear, O God, when I cry with my voice. Alleluia! The Lord is my Light and my Salvation; whom shall I fear? When You said, "Seek My face," my heart said to You: "Your face, Lord I will seek." Do not hide Your face from me. Glory...
gradual:
God reigns over the nations,
God sits on His holy throne.
I will pour out the Spirit of grace and supplication
And they will look on Me whom they have pierced.
I will not leave you orphans; I am going away and coming back to you
And your heart shall rejoice.
Hallelujah! Christ, our Passover is sacrificed for us.
Therefore let us keep the feast. Hallelujah!

theme: Renewed Obedience: Jesus Cleanses the Temple
introit: As for me, I will call upon God, He shall hear my voice. He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle which was against me. God will hear, and afflict them, even He who abides of old. Cast your burden on the Lord, and He shall sustain you. Give ear to my prayer, O God, and do not hide Yourself. Glory...
gradual:
Keep me as the apple of Your eye;
Hide me under the shadow of Your wings.
Let my vindication come from Your presence;
Let Your eyes look on the things that are upright.
O Lord, God of my salvation,
I have cried out day and night before You.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

theme: Law and Gospel: The Great Commandment
introit: Reward them who wait for You, O Lord, and let Your prophets be found faithful. Hear the prayer of Your servants and of Your people Israel. I was glad when they said to me, "Let us go into the house of the Lord." Glory...
gradual:
I was glad when they said to me,
Let us go into the house of the Lord.
Peace be within your walls,
Prosperity within your palaces.
Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles!
Laud Him, all you peoples!
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: Surely He has borne our griefs and carried our sorrows. He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities. All we like sheep have gone astray: and the Lord has laid on Him the iniquity of us all. Hear my prayer, O Lord: and let my cry come to You.  [The Gloria Patri is omitted on this day.]

I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

The lightnings lit up the world, the earth trembled and shook. Blessed are those who dwell in Your house. How lovely is Your tabernacle, O Lord of hosts! My soul longs, yes, even faints for the courts of the Lord. Glory...
gradual:
You are fairer than the sons of men
Grace is poured upon Your lips.
The Lord said to my Lord;
“Sit at My right hand, till I make Your enemies Your footstool.”
Sing to the Lord, bless His Name; proclaim the good news of His salvation from day to day.
Declare His glory among the nations.
Jesus Christ is the Light to lighten the Gentiles,
The Glory of Your people Israel.

introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...
Blessed be the Holy Trinity and the undivided Unity; let us give glory to Him because He has shown mercy to us. O Lord, our Lord, how excellent is Your Name in all the earth! Glory...
gradual:
Who beholds the deep and who dwells between the cherubim.
Blessed are You, O Lord,
In the firmament of heaven, and greatly to be praised forever.
Blessed are You, O Lord,
God of our fathers, and greatly to be praised forever.
Blessed be the Lord God of our fathers,
Praise Him and highly exalt Him forever.

theme: Citizenship: Render to Caesar and to God
introit: I know the thoughts I think toward you, says the Lord, thoughts of peace and not of evil. Then you will call upon Me and pray to Me, and I will listen to you. Lord, You have been favorable to Your land; You have brought back the captivity of Jacob. Glory...
gradual:
And have put to shame those who hated us.
In God we boast all day long,
And praise Your Name forever.
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;
He is their Help and their Shield.
Put on the whole armor of God,
That you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

theme: Living in the Light of God's Word
introit: I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. There is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give to me. O LORD, You have searched me and known me. You know my sitting down and my rising up; You understand my thought afar off. Glory...

Have respect, O Lord, to Your covenant; do not let the oppressed return ashamed. Arise, O God, plead Your own cause; do not forget the voice of Your enemies. O God, why have You cast us off forever? Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture? Glory...
gradual:
Have respect, O Lord, to Your covenant;
Do not let the oppressed return ashamed.
Arise, O God, plead Your own cause;
Do not forget the voice of Your enemies.
O Lord, God of my salvation;
I have cried out day and night before You.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

theme: Christian Freedom: Healing on the Sabbath
introit: Righteous are You, O Lord, and upright are Your judgments. Deal with Your servant according to Your mercy. Blessed are the undefiled in the way, Who walk in the law of the Lord. Glory...
gradual:
Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord
And the people whom He has chosen as His own inheritance.
By the Word of the Lord the heavens were made.
And all the host of them by the breath of His mouth.
The Right Hand of the Lord is exalted;
The Right Hand of the Lord does valiantly.
Your Word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.

introit: He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him, I will deliver him and honor him. With long life I will satisfy him and show him My Salvation. He that dwells in the secret place of the Most High Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty. Glory...
gradual:
He shall give His angels charge over you
To keep you in all your ways.
They shall bear you up in their hands
Lest you dash your foot against a stone.
He that dwells in the secret place of the Most High
Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
Christ has humbled Himself and become obedient unto death,
Even the death of the Cross.
